<h4 id="datasourceconfigurationwebcrawlerconfiguration">Data<wbr>Source<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Web<wbr>Crawler<wbr>Configuration</h4>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="urls_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#urls_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Urls</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#datasourceconfigurationwebcrawlerconfigurationurls">Data<wbr>Source<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Web<wbr>Crawler<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Urls</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A block that specifies the seed or starting point URLs of the websites or the sitemap URLs of the websites you want to crawl. You can include website subdomains. You can list up to <code>100</code> seed URLs and up to <code>3</code> sitemap URLs. You can only crawl websites that use the secure communication protocol, Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS). If you receive an error when crawling a website, it could be that the website is blocked from crawling. When selecting websites to index, you must adhere to the <a href="https://aws.amazon.com/aup/">Amazon Acceptable Use Policy</a> and all other Amazon terms. Remember that you must only use Amazon Kendra Web Crawler to index your own webpages, or webpages that you have authorization to index. Detailed below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="authenticationconfiguration_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#authenticationconfiguration_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Authentication<wbr>Configuration</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#datasourceconfigurationwebcrawlerconfigurationauthenticationconfiguration">Data<wbr>Source<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Web<wbr>Crawler<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Authentication<wbr>Configuration</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A block with the configuration information required to connect to websites using authentication. You can connect to websites using basic authentication of user name and password. You use a secret in AWS Secrets Manager to store your authentication credentials. You must provide the website host name and port number. For example, the host name of <code>https://a.example.com/page1.html</code> is <code>&quot;a.example.com&quot;</code> and the port is <code>443</code>, the standard port for HTTPS. Detailed below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="crawldepth_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#crawldepth_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Crawl<wbr>Depth</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the number of levels in a website that you want to crawl. The first level begins from the website seed or starting point URL. For example, if a website has 3 levels – index level (i.e. seed in this example), sections level, and subsections level – and you are only interested in crawling information up to the sections level (i.e. levels 0-1), you can set your depth to 1. The default crawl depth is set to <code>2</code>. Minimum value of <code>0</code>. Maximum value of <code>10</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="maxcontentsizeperpageinmegabytes_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#maxcontentsizeperpageinmegabytes_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Max<wbr>Content<wbr>Size<wbr>Per<wbr>Page<wbr>In<wbr>Mega<wbr>Bytes</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">double</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The maximum size (in MB) of a webpage or attachment to crawl. Files larger than this size (in MB) are skipped/not crawled. The default maximum size of a webpage or attachment is set to <code>50</code> MB. Minimum value of <code>1.0e-06</code>. Maximum value of <code>50</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="maxlinksperpage_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#maxlinksperpage_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Max<wbr>Links<wbr>Per<wbr>Page</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The maximum number of URLs on a webpage to include when crawling a website. This number is per webpage. As a website’s webpages are crawled, any URLs the webpages link to are also crawled. URLs on a webpage are crawled in order of appearance. The default maximum links per page is <code>100</code>. Minimum value of <code>1</code>. Maximum value of <code>1000</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="maxurlsperminutecrawlrate_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#maxurlsperminutecrawlrate_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Max<wbr>Urls<wbr>Per<wbr>Minute<wbr>Crawl<wbr>Rate</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The maximum number of URLs crawled per website host per minute. The default maximum number of URLs crawled per website host per minute is <code>300</code>. Minimum value of <code>1</code>. Maximum value of <code>300</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="proxyconfiguration_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#proxyconfiguration_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Proxy<wbr>Configuration</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#datasourceconfigurationwebcrawlerconfigurationproxyconfiguration">Data<wbr>Source<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Web<wbr>Crawler<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Proxy<wbr>Configuration</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Configuration information required to connect to your internal websites via a web proxy. You must provide the website host name and port number. For example, the host name of <code>https://a.example.com/page1.html</code> is <code>&quot;a.example.com&quot;</code> and the port is <code>443</code>, the standard port for HTTPS. Web proxy credentials are optional and you can use them to connect to a web proxy server that requires basic authentication. To store web proxy credentials, you use a secret in <a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/secretsmanager/latest/userguide/intro.html">AWS Secrets Manager</a>. Detailed below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="urlexclusionpatterns_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#urlexclusionpatterns_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Url<wbr>Exclusion<wbr>Patterns</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;string&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A list of regular expression patterns to exclude certain URLs to crawl. URLs that match the patterns are excluded from the index. URLs that don't match the patterns are included in the index. If a URL matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the URL file isn't included in the index. Array Members: Minimum number of <code>0</code> items. Maximum number of <code>100</code> items. Length Constraints: Minimum length of <code>1</code>. Maximum length of <code>150</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="urlinclusionpatterns_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#urlinclusionpatterns_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Url<wbr>Inclusion<wbr>Patterns</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;string&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A list of regular expression patterns to include certain URLs to crawl. URLs that match the patterns are included in the index. URLs that don't match the patterns are excluded from the index. If a URL matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the URL file isn't included in the index. Array Members: Minimum number of <code>0</code> items. Maximum number of <code>100</code> items. Length Constraints: Minimum length of <code>1</code>. Maximum length of <code>150</code>.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="go">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="urls_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#urls_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Urls</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#datasourceconfigurationwebcrawlerconfigurationurls">Data<wbr>Source<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Web<wbr>Crawler<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Urls</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A block that specifies the seed or starting point URLs of the websites or the sitemap URLs of the websites you want to crawl. You can include website subdomains. You can list up to <code>100</code> seed URLs and up to <code>3</code> sitemap URLs. You can only crawl websites that use the secure communication protocol, Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS). If you receive an error when crawling a website, it could be that the website is blocked from crawling. When selecting websites to index, you must adhere to the <a href="https://aws.amazon.com/aup/">Amazon Acceptable Use Policy</a> and all other Amazon terms. Remember that you must only use Amazon Kendra Web Crawler to index your own webpages, or webpages that you have authorization to index. Detailed below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="authenticationconfiguration_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#authenticationconfiguration_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Authentication<wbr>Configuration</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#datasourceconfigurationwebcrawlerconfigurationauthenticationconfiguration">Data<wbr>Source<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Web<wbr>Crawler<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Authentication<wbr>Configuration</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A block with the configuration information required to connect to websites using authentication. You can connect to websites using basic authentication of user name and password. You use a secret in AWS Secrets Manager to store your authentication credentials. You must provide the website host name and port number. For example, the host name of <code>https://a.example.com/page1.html</code> is <code>&quot;a.example.com&quot;</code> and the port is <code>443</code>, the standard port for HTTPS. Detailed below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="crawldepth_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#crawldepth_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Crawl<wbr>Depth</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the number of levels in a website that you want to crawl. The first level begins from the website seed or starting point URL. For example, if a website has 3 levels – index level (i.e. seed in this example), sections level, and subsections level – and you are only interested in crawling information up to the sections level (i.e. levels 0-1), you can set your depth to 1. The default crawl depth is set to <code>2</code>. Minimum value of <code>0</code>. Maximum value of <code>10</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="maxcontentsizeperpageinmegabytes_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#maxcontentsizeperpageinmegabytes_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Max<wbr>Content<wbr>Size<wbr>Per<wbr>Page<wbr>In<wbr>Mega<wbr>Bytes</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">float64</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The maximum size (in MB) of a webpage or attachment to crawl. Files larger than this size (in MB) are skipped/not crawled. The default maximum size of a webpage or attachment is set to <code>50</code> MB. Minimum value of <code>1.0e-06</code>. Maximum value of <code>50</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="maxlinksperpage_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#maxlinksperpage_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Max<wbr>Links<wbr>Per<wbr>Page</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The maximum number of URLs on a webpage to include when crawling a website. This number is per webpage. As a website’s webpages are crawled, any URLs the webpages link to are also crawled. URLs on a webpage are crawled in order of appearance. The default maximum links per page is <code>100</code>. Minimum value of <code>1</code>. Maximum value of <code>1000</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="maxurlsperminutecrawlrate_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#maxurlsperminutecrawlrate_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Max<wbr>Urls<wbr>Per<wbr>Minute<wbr>Crawl<wbr>Rate</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The maximum number of URLs crawled per website host per minute. The default maximum number of URLs crawled per website host per minute is <code>300</code>. Minimum value of <code>1</code>. Maximum value of <code>300</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="proxyconfiguration_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#proxyconfiguration_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Proxy<wbr>Configuration</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#datasourceconfigurationwebcrawlerconfigurationproxyconfiguration">Data<wbr>Source<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Web<wbr>Crawler<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Proxy<wbr>Configuration</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Configuration information required to connect to your internal websites via a web proxy. You must provide the website host name and port number. For example, the host name of <code>https://a.example.com/page1.html</code> is <code>&quot;a.example.com&quot;</code> and the port is <code>443</code>, the standard port for HTTPS. Web proxy credentials are optional and you can use them to connect to a web proxy server that requires basic authentication. To store web proxy credentials, you use a secret in <a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/secretsmanager/latest/userguide/intro.html">AWS Secrets Manager</a>. Detailed below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="urlexclusionpatterns_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#urlexclusionpatterns_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Url<wbr>Exclusion<wbr>Patterns</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">[]string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A list of regular expression patterns to exclude certain URLs to crawl. URLs that match the patterns are excluded from the index. URLs that don't match the patterns are included in the index. If a URL matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the URL file isn't included in the index. Array Members: Minimum number of <code>0</code> items. Maximum number of <code>100</code> items. Length Constraints: Minimum length of <code>1</code>. Maximum length of <code>150</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="urlinclusionpatterns_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#urlinclusionpatterns_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Url<wbr>Inclusion<wbr>Patterns</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">[]string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A list of regular expression patterns to include certain URLs to crawl. URLs that match the patterns are included in the index. URLs that don't match the patterns are excluded from the index. If a URL matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the URL file isn't included in the index. Array Members: Minimum number of <code>0</code> items. Maximum number of <code>100</code> items. Length Constraints: Minimum length of <code>1</code>. Maximum length of <code>150</code>.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>

        <span id="urlinclusionpatterns_nodejs">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#urlinclusionpatterns_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">url<wbr>Inclusion<wbr>Patterns</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string[]</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A list of regular expression patterns to include certain URLs to crawl. URLs that match the patterns are included in the index. URLs that don't match the patterns are excluded from the index. If a URL matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the URL file isn't included in the index. Array Members: Minimum number of <code>0</code> items. Maximum number of <code>100</code> items. Length Constraints: Minimum length of <code>1</code>. Maximum length of <code>150</code>.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>

<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="go">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>

<h4 id="datasourceconfigurationwebcrawlerconfigurationurls">Data<wbr>Source<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Web<wbr>Crawler<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Urls</h4>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="seedurlconfiguration_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#seedurlconfiguration_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Seed<wbr>Url<wbr>Configuration</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#datasourceconfigurationwebcrawlerconfigurationurlsseedurlconfiguration">Data<wbr>Source<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Web<wbr>Crawler<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Urls<wbr>Seed<wbr>Url<wbr>Configuration</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A block that specifies the configuration of the seed or starting point URLs of the websites you want to crawl. You can choose to crawl only the website host names, or the website host names with subdomains, or the website host names with subdomains and other domains that the webpages link to. You can list up to <code>100</code> seed URLs. Detailed below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="sitemapsconfiguration_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#sitemapsconfiguration_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Site<wbr>Maps<wbr>Configuration</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#datasourceconfigurationwebcrawlerconfigurationurlssitemapsconfiguration">Data<wbr>Source<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Web<wbr>Crawler<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Urls<wbr>Site<wbr>Maps<wbr>Configuration</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A block that specifies the configuration of the sitemap URLs of the websites you want to crawl. Only URLs belonging to the same website host names are crawled. You can list up to <code>3</code> sitemap URLs. Detailed below.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>

<h4 id="datasourcecustomdocumentenrichmentconfiguration">Data<wbr>Source<wbr>Custom<wbr>Document<wbr>Enrichment<wbr>Configuration</h4>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="inlineconfigurations_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#inlineconfigurations_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Inline<wbr>Configurations</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#datasourcecustomdocumentenrichmentconfigurationinlineconfiguration">List&lt;Data<wbr>Source<wbr>Custom<wbr>Document<wbr>Enrichment<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Inline<wbr>Configuration&gt;</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Configuration information to alter document attributes or metadata fields and content when ingesting documents into Amazon Kendra. Minimum number of <code>0</code> items. Maximum number of <code>100</code> items. Detailed below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="postextractionhookconfiguration_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#postextractionhookconfiguration_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Post<wbr>Extraction<wbr>Hook<wbr>Configuration</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#datasourcecustomdocumentenrichmentconfigurationpostextractionhookconfiguration">Data<wbr>Source<wbr>Custom<wbr>Document<wbr>Enrichment<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Post<wbr>Extraction<wbr>Hook<wbr>Configuration</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A block that specifies the configuration information for invoking a Lambda function in AWS Lambda on the structured documents with their metadata and text extracted. You can use a Lambda function to apply advanced logic for creating, modifying, or deleting document metadata and content. For more information, see <a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/kendra/latest/dg/custom-document-enrichment.html#advanced-data-manipulation">Advanced data manipulation</a>. Detailed below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="preextractionhookconfiguration_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#preextractionhookconfiguration_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Pre<wbr>Extraction<wbr>Hook<wbr>Configuration</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#datasourcecustomdocumentenrichmentconfigurationpreextractionhookconfiguration">Data<wbr>Source<wbr>Custom<wbr>Document<wbr>Enrichment<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Pre<wbr>Extraction<wbr>Hook<wbr>Configuration</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Configuration information for invoking a Lambda function in AWS Lambda on the original or raw documents before extracting their metadata and text. You can use a Lambda function to apply advanced logic for creating, modifying, or deleting document metadata and content. For more information, see <a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/kendra/latest/dg/custom-document-enrichment.html#advanced-data-manipulation">Advanced data manipulation</a>. Detailed below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="rolearn_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#rolearn_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Role<wbr>Arn</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a role with permission to run <code>pre_extraction_hook_configuration</code> and <code>post_extraction_hook_configuration</code> for altering document metadata and content during the document ingestion process. For more information, see <a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/kendra/latest/dg/iam-roles.html">IAM roles for Amazon Kendra</a>.</p>
</dd></dl>

<h4 id="datasourcecustomdocumentenrichmentconfigurationinlineconfigurationcondition">Data<wbr>Source<wbr>Custom<wbr>Document<wbr>Enrichment<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Inline<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Condition</h4>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="conditiondocumentattributekey_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#conditiondocumentattributekey_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Condition<wbr>Document<wbr>Attribute<wbr>Key</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The identifier of the document attribute used for the condition. For example, <code>_source_uri</code> could be an identifier for the attribute or metadata field that contains source URIs associated with the documents. Amazon Kendra currently does not support <code>_document_body</code> as an attribute key used for the condition.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="operator_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#operator_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Operator</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The condition operator. For example, you can use <code>Contains</code> to partially match a string. Valid Values: <code>GreaterThan</code> | <code>GreaterThanOrEquals</code> | <code>LessThan</code> | <code>LessThanOrEquals</code> | <code>Equals</code> | <code>NotEquals</code> | <code>Contains</code> | <code>NotContains</code> | <code>Exists</code> | <code>NotExists</code> | <code>BeginsWith</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="conditiononvalue_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#conditiononvalue_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Condition<wbr>On<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#datasourcecustomdocumentenrichmentconfigurationinlineconfigurationconditionconditiononvalue">Data<wbr>Source<wbr>Custom<wbr>Document<wbr>Enrichment<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Inline<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Condition<wbr>Condition<wbr>On<wbr>Value</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The value used by the operator. For example, you can specify the value 'financial' for strings in the <code>_source_uri</code> field that partially match or contain this value. See condition_on_value.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

            title="Optional">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The identifier of the target document attribute or metadata field. For example, 'Department' could be an identifier for the target attribute or metadata field that includes the department names associated with the documents.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="targetdocumentattributevalue_csharp">

    </dt>
    <dd><p>The target value you want to create for the target attribute. For example, 'Finance' could be the target value for the target attribute key 'Department'. See target_document_attribute_value.</p>

        <span class="property-type">bool</span>
    </dt>

<h4 id="datasourcecustomdocumentenrichmentconfigurationpostextractionhookconfiguration">Data<wbr>Source<wbr>Custom<wbr>Document<wbr>Enrichment<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Post<wbr>Extraction<wbr>Hook<wbr>Configuration</h4>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="lambdaarn_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#lambdaarn_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Lambda<wbr>Arn</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a Lambda Function that can manipulate your document metadata fields or attributes and content.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="s3bucket_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#s3bucket_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">S3Bucket</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Stores the original, raw documents or the structured, parsed documents before and after altering them. For more information, see <a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/kendra/latest/dg/custom-document-enrichment.html#cde-data-contracts-lambda">Data contracts for Lambda functions</a>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="invocationcondition_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#invocationcondition_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Invocation<wbr>Condition</a>
</span>

    </dt>
    <dd><p>A block that specifies the condition used for when a Lambda function should be invoked. For example, you can specify a condition that if there are empty date-time values, then Amazon Kendra should invoke a function that inserts the current date-time. See invocation_condition.</p>
</dd></dl>

<h4 id="datasourcecustomdocumentenrichmentconfigurationpostextractionhookconfigurationinvocationcondition">Data<wbr>Source<wbr>Custom<wbr>Document<wbr>Enrichment<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Post<wbr>Extraction<wbr>Hook<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Invocation<wbr>Condition</h4>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="conditiondocumentattributekey_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#conditiondocumentattributekey_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Condition<wbr>Document<wbr>Attribute<wbr>Key</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The identifier of the document attribute used for the condition. For example, <code>_source_uri</code> could be an identifier for the attribute or metadata field that contains source URIs associated with the documents. Amazon Kendra currently does not support <code>_document_body</code> as an attribute key used for the condition.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="operator_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#operator_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Operator</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The condition operator. For example, you can use <code>Contains</code> to partially match a string. Valid Values: <code>GreaterThan</code> | <code>GreaterThanOrEquals</code> | <code>LessThan</code> | <code>LessThanOrEquals</code> | <code>Equals</code> | <code>NotEquals</code> | <code>Contains</code> | <code>NotContains</code> | <code>Exists</code> | <code>NotExists</code> | <code>BeginsWith</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="conditiononvalue_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#conditiononvalue_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Condition<wbr>On<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#datasourcecustomdocumentenrichmentconfigurationpostextractionhookconfigurationinvocationconditionconditiononvalue">Data<wbr>Source<wbr>Custom<wbr>Document<wbr>Enrichment<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Post<wbr>Extraction<wbr>Hook<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Invocation<wbr>Condition<wbr>Condition<wbr>On<wbr>Value</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The value used by the operator. For example, you can specify the value 'financial' for strings in the <code>_source_uri</code> field that partially match or contain this value. See condition_on_value.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#datasourcecustomdocumentenrichmentconfigurationpostextractionhookconfigurationinvocationconditionconditiononvalue">Data<wbr>Source<wbr>Custom<wbr>Document<wbr>Enrichment<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Post<wbr>Extraction<wbr>Hook<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Invocation<wbr>Condition<wbr>Condition<wbr>On<wbr>Value</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The value used by the operator. For example, you can specify the value 'financial' for strings in the <code>_source_uri</code> field that partially match or contain this value. See condition_on_value.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>

<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="lambdaarn_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#lambdaarn_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Lambda<wbr>Arn</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a Lambda Function that can manipulate your document metadata fields or attributes and content.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="s3bucket_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#s3bucket_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">S3Bucket</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Stores the original, raw documents or the structured, parsed documents before and after altering them. For more information, see <a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/kendra/latest/dg/custom-document-enrichment.html#cde-data-contracts-lambda">Data contracts for Lambda functions</a>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="invocationcondition_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#invocationcondition_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Invocation<wbr>Condition</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#datasourcecustomdocumentenrichmentconfigurationpreextractionhookconfigurationinvocationcondition">Data<wbr>Source<wbr>Custom<wbr>Document<wbr>Enrichment<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Pre<wbr>Extraction<wbr>Hook<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Invocation<wbr>Condition</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A block that specifies the condition used for when a Lambda function should be invoked. For example, you can specify a condition that if there are empty date-time values, then Amazon Kendra should invoke a function that inserts the current date-time. See invocation_condition.</p>
</dd></dl>

<h4 id="datasourcecustomdocumentenrichmentconfigurationpreextractionhookconfigurationinvocationcondition">Data<wbr>Source<wbr>Custom<wbr>Document<wbr>Enrichment<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Pre<wbr>Extraction<wbr>Hook<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Invocation<wbr>Condition</h4>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="conditiondocumentattributekey_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#conditiondocumentattributekey_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Condition<wbr>Document<wbr>Attribute<wbr>Key</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The identifier of the document attribute used for the condition. For example, <code>_source_uri</code> could be an identifier for the attribute or metadata field that contains source URIs associated with the documents. Amazon Kendra currently does not support <code>_document_body</code> as an attribute key used for the condition.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="operator_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#operator_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Operator</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The condition operator. For example, you can use <code>Contains</code> to partially match a string. Valid Values: <code>GreaterThan</code> | <code>GreaterThanOrEquals</code> | <code>LessThan</code> | <code>LessThanOrEquals</code> | <code>Equals</code> | <code>NotEquals</code> | <code>Contains</code> | <code>NotContains</code> | <code>Exists</code> | <code>NotExists</code> | <code>BeginsWith</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="conditiononvalue_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#conditiononvalue_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Condition<wbr>On<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#datasourcecustomdocumentenrichmentconfigurationpreextractionhookconfigurationinvocationconditionconditiononvalue">Data<wbr>Source<wbr>Custom<wbr>Document<wbr>Enrichment<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Pre<wbr>Extraction<wbr>Hook<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Invocation<wbr>Condition<wbr>Condition<wbr>On<wbr>Value</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The value used by the operator. For example, you can specify the value 'financial' for strings in the <code>_source_uri</code> field that partially match or contain this value. See condition_on_value.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

    <dd><p>The identifier of the document attribute used for the condition. For example, <code>_source_uri</code> could be an identifier for the attribute or metadata field that contains source URIs associated with the documents. Amazon Kendra currently does not support <code>_document_body</code> as an attribute key used for the condition.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="operator_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#operator_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">operator</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The condition operator. For example, you can use <code>Contains</code> to partially match a string. Valid Values: <code>GreaterThan</code> | <code>GreaterThanOrEquals</code> | <code>LessThan</code> | <code>LessThanOrEquals</code> | <code>Equals</code> | <code>NotEquals</code> | <code>Contains</code> | <code>NotContains</code> | <code>Exists</code> | <code>NotExists</code> | <code>BeginsWith</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="conditiononvalue_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#conditiononvalue_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">condition<wbr>On<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#datasourcecustomdocumentenrichmentconfigurationpreextractionhookconfigurationinvocationconditionconditiononvalue">Property Map</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The value used by the operator. For example, you can specify the value 'financial' for strings in the <code>_source_uri</code> field that partially match or contain this value. See condition_on_value.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

## Import



Using `pulumi import`, import Kendra Data Source using the unique identifiers of the data_source and index separated by a slash (`/`). For example:

```sh
 $ pulumi import aws:kendra/dataSource:DataSource example 1045d08d-66ef-4882-b3ed-dfb7df183e90/b34dfdf7-1f2b-4704-9581-79e00296845f
```
